intro: Selliguea bellisquamata, commonly known as the velvet moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth form and its dark green, velvety appearance. The plant typically grows on shaded, moist surfaces such as rocks, soil, or decaying wood in temperate regions. Its leaves are closely appressed and have a distinctive, smooth texture. Selliguea bellisquamata plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for microorganisms in its ecosystem.
